message: Linear thinkers at high slopes, pointing at and puncturing the limits of their spheres of influence.
Reflecting symmetries, a threading mathematician inflects reflexives — straightening the poet's field with arrows from his quiver.
The audience in despair, darts everywhere. And here they are, brothers in arms, one sees an arrow, the other the point.﻿
more background, but about the image in the background:

I'm tempted to put a lengthy interpretation here, in relation to Boris' post, but also as the second stance's imagery has extra meaning for mathematicians. Or maybe that would kill the joy for those who would
dare to dive for results on their own!
Today's mathematics has a firm grip on linear methods, but anything beyond is inherently elusive, mysterious, and magical.

This is an anthem for the people who fall astern that night when I'll be crossing, as if it were sad to be stuck in life! I'm fine and determined to stay, but sometimes you have to ponder death or your life will become colorless and pale. Fear not, read on, and I'll show you the source and reason for beauty in my life.

As a child I would follow my great granny, she would insist that, when death were visiting her house, she'd prepare a cup of tea. To share a few civilized minutes in its presence, eyes up, and with a smile, awaiting the ultimtive intimate, yet intangible experience that is our fate. You will see this just once, and it is only for you!

Later in my life I would admit that the tea is a misplaced artifact, and while it seems right to capture the personal aspect by projecting out, by imagining that death had a personality, it is really much more. It is boundary, a very sharp edge, of which we know only one side. Everything across will have to go!

When an idea, an emotion, or anything else seems fuzzy, you can use death as a tool to separate the factual, all the true and what is alive, from nothingness, the impossible and all that is not: Open the door, just ask for company as if it were a stranger just about to ring the bell, and let him in!

Set up the stove, make it green tea (because it is healthier), and, like a good host, give him everything he asks for! I can't express how serious I am with it, you need to understand that the absolute is not under your control, and just let go. Look again, he... it is sitting over there, staring at you, waiting for... nothing, for the right moment!

See this habit? That shoe? Was it yours? You don't need to haste in loops and anymore, no need to bear another sunset or bring up any more of your beautiful smiles. Every bit and piece of your life is united in the only meaning this highest peak can support, before your attachment to the ground finally ends.

Can you see the colors now, filling the shadows? Or will you try to get there, later? Please? Because you need to know, because it will make you free, enable you to really feel everybody and everything as if it were all part of yourself. It's more than a projection, it is forging the experience of what you are into a whole, complete and perfect place in space and time.

If you make it, if you get there, if just for a few seconds, then greet my friends (many of which still alive), who had been serious with me. Who held my hands when we jumped together, so we could aware the majestic, the happening, the flow of time itself, into us having stopped to make any difference.

and no distortion! But, you may ask, where are the antennas, it's all buckled, and these bulbs aren't round at all! Yes. You're right. There's a trick. And there is absolutely no way to get rid of the antennas!
, far away from the main set! I've cranked down the iteration depth to
for the first image, the second has
. Most of this difference is spent in the thin knee near the lower left of the second picture.
The slope is pretty crass this deep in the
, so to get beyond the shades into bright daylight, to make the last dark speck vanish in the sub-pixel range,

has to climb to the order of a million! The assumption that each turn eats a few thousand cycles leads to the conclusion that there are but a few hundred windings before that largest spiral sinks into its destined pixel.

That's quite a bit for the resolution exhibited here, and the closer we get to a mu set, the more incomprehensible noise spreads into view. Stuffing the filaments as if attempting to imitate the bulbs on the large cardioid! At other places the noise tends to fill all free space, but I doubt that that will happen here.
Next time, I'll have another storylet for you. Promised!
A nice discussion ensued! Go and have a look!﻿

Things started disappearing. At first, I couldn't find stuff I had not needed, and put somewhere a while ago. Then things I'd just placed out of sight, infuriatingly never to be seen again. Then people from my past, and later ones even while I was speaking to them! Erased. Nobody remembered. When my left foot went out of my sight forever, I got scared. Really scared. So I told a stranger. I would have preferred a friend, but there weren't any left!

This guy's friendly bald face said slowly and steadily that I should see a doctor right away. The doctor, in a building just around the corner, had the same appearance, the same face! Except that he was wearing a colorless and featureless body suit. Looking at us, he seemed to wonder about my state the same way he did about his own appearance. The new friend at my side raised his arms in helpless excuse, turned, while catching what might have been an expression of appreciation and amazement from the doctor, peppered with a serious pair of eyebrows.

And then my new friend walked straight into a white wall, leaving me with this other stranger, and of himself a small crayoned sketch on the wall, showing him sitting in an adjacent room. My heart was pounding, dark shadows throbbing in the corner of my eyes. This wasn't how things were supposed to be! "I'll help you", the doctor said, "your outer shells have degraded and you're stuck in yourself. I haven't seen a mishap like this before, but you'll be better soon."

He pointed a spoon at me, and I heard a muffled bang, like a gunshot far away, and taking my hand we walked out on a balcony hanging above a huge... garden? landscape? Where there should be... stained streets of the endless polis. "We don't need those anymore. You have constrained yourself by, apparently, not taking back ignorances you've put in your filter bubble..." he started his healing lecture. Meanwhile he was pulling up faces to tell him things from my past I had forgotten.

There was something strange going on with language and meaning of what they, and the doctor, said. 'He was just sitting there, under a tree, staring', would also highlight a set of romances I remembered with what I then had believed were different persons. Memories of intimate encounters contrasting a picture of an elderly woman, bending down to look an idiot under a tree in the eye. "I'm sorry you feel that way" the doctor said. "It'll wear off quickly", while grabbing my my arm so I wouldn't fly away. I was literally levitating!

Another hollow bang, I'm looking at the doctor's face, it morphing slightly and slowly into various directions, and returning into its familiar shape each time. We were sitting in camping chairs, in a shy wilderness in the shadow of a large concrete bridge. "You're over 800 years old. You lost control over your filters. Because you forgot to undo them. Reconfigured yourself to forget about an itch, and then another." I faintly heard distant oriental flutes, now it was the background morphing, while his face kept steady.
"No," he said, "that's just an illusion. Don't try to move, or to understand, just listen to me!".

. She was an illusion! I had never met her! Tears came out of me distorting his gesture, shaking his head, putting a hand over his eyes. Poff. I was standing in a kitchen, naked, chopping vegetables for salad. I asked for my clothes, and she laughed. "It's the clothes that make you ashamed. You don't really have to wear naked below your chosen appearance." And then her laughter escalated as I had rugged the whole kitchen around me, apparently using a spare dimension I hadn't known to avail. Poff.

"Listen, I'm trying to install a sci-fi access rail for you to hold on. But you have to stop fiddling around! Please!" He was handing me a hand sized flat box with a shiny surface on one side. On it, a chat session unfolding in plain english. One speaker marked with a crayoned diving mask, the other a white ball...﻿
You've found him, so you're expected to at least add to the ethic considerations!
How could I, he could have been doing who knows what, and burdening me with the decision what to remove and what to keep is unethical﻿!
So we'll operate then. You have another day to rethink, or ask any friends he might have.
With his puny processing power that may well be more than a decade subjectively! Are you insane?
Look, he's been there for much longer. He'd probably been bitten by animals over and over. He'll be fine here!
No, you look: Here's one of the 'animals', it's clearly symbiotic with him!
But they don't have our cultural roots, the available bands are so few that they'd be constantly misunderstanding each other. Heck, he'd probably lived through a couple of wars personally by now.
Okay, I'm not a philosophist, you're probably right. But can't you get on with it right away?

No, he's going to lose everything, even if only for a short while. This moment is so critical that it should emerge naturally. We'll inject our discussion so you can help out if any of his presences show up. Just wait...

Where else than on the attic of a long abandoned house could I have found something like this. Creeping in the backmost and darkest corner, buried behind wooden boxes that were filled with with mystifying tools for construction work I'm not familiar with, scattered pieces of a disassembled motor scooter, from a dusty box full of tin soldiers I had pulled a mousy strip of semitransparent plastic tape. Well, I didn't 'find' it... In the narrow, it had crept up my sleeve and stuck to it!

I wouldn't have noticed if it weren't on our white kitchen table illuminated by the shadowless bright of the ring shaped lamp above, when the semitransparent plastic strip came off and fell flat on the glaring tabletop. It hat intricate colors and a regular square pattern intensely drawing my gaze to it. I took a macro shot with my wristband pal and stared at the magnification that would correspond blowing it up to the extents of a soccer field.

It took me a few days of research and a bit augmented analysis to decipher what turned out to be a microfiche, containing an artfully steganographed message for the future. A message hidden in the data patterns of a database of obscure citations, that could only be decoded, noticed even, by understanding its key. And that key I was lucky to find on that same page, encoded in pictures of knots, commonly used by a long extinct tribe of native south americans to keep their books in balance...

You can imagine, I felt exhilarated. These were obviously notes for a painting! By someone who seems to have given a lot of thoughts to imaging the gods. It describes a bathroom scene in which the horrified symbolic manchild, a beautiful woman, who may be pregnant or not, just like that smile in Leonardo's infamous portrait, becomes an involuntary witness of the god's hygiene, terrified to panic by what she sees.

The gods themselves may be something like posthuman beings, clad in captiously seamless ideal artwork of classic human beauty. They're using the machinery in the scene's background, a scape looking like a gigerian idea of pioneer day's car repair shops, to dismantle their superficial appearances, revealing mechanical guts, and remnants of what they were, connecting that gore to the background.

I suppose we should imagine them staring back at us from the height of millenia. A flicker of one of our lives, barely noticed by them. And her burden of enlightenment — of the type that had been preceded by many earlier ones... Ours perhaps?

The image shows an impression I obtained from overlaying two recording artifacts from my dreams in the following night. Supposedly it's a small detail from a city sized apparatus in the lower left of the scene.

person walking in front of me? Is she wondering, like me, or busy running from or towards something, or someone? Or that one, did he just walk through me? Has his light spiced scent the shape of childhood, even if not mine? Or is it now - i'm seen through weeping eyes, with a reason overbearing what i had never known: The secret ingredient that makes water into tears.
بدي أتعرف مين معي أنا أسمي مال شام ورد
Where am i? Don't move. Wait for the perspective to make sense. The place

... microbes peculiar to... a broken washing machine... unconditioned air... Convulsively i take a deep breath, breezing memories, drifting years and years of frustration. Home. While i close my eyes to rub off star charts of microbial populations thriving in western cities, a small boy darts a picture at me, rolled up like a newspaper.
The above is actually a phoenix as comes with XaoS. Nobody realized, so we're private here. Tell me...

is something very peculiar. In early morning, especially when alone, they sonemtimes sneak about and suddenly break into laughter, hehehe. Other times, small flocks seem to swirl above the sleeping city, screaming, quarreling...

But sometimes, when the sun doesn't break haze, their call seems to come from everywhere, soaking in desire for freedom. Maybe the ocean is now devoid of food, maybe it's an urgent message for me. Maybe i'll never be free.

fight came in a starless night, with a puff, leaving a trail of feathers. We were to meet in the second before Kêr-Is fell, in the hour of lover's death. At the invisible palace, erected in a cloud - perching before upraising with the sun, but frozen in time. I crossed the vapor pond riding a balloon, and found the square with all my friends sleeping.
. Luckily it's not finished yet and nothing is wasted. Sqeeze a bit here, put slightly out of shape there. To make the eye restless, so the mind will take time to work itself into details.
​! It's indeed one of my long-time favorites. The proportions came out so nicely balanced. That day, luck was my friend.

first hit me i walked tireless, like in trance, to finally reach the sea. My feet had been the only home i knew for too long. But seeing this vast, taunting my attempts to comprehend, while feeling home at the same time was deeply frightening. Not because of what i could now see, feel, immerse myself in, but because with realizing that the whole world was my home, always had been. And i got lost.
It's the face of my clock, right after

. Looking up, i see a projection i call a tree. Of a wavy four dimensional woodland deity, banded in green and purple. Combed and rocked by star and sunlight, tomographed to earth. Wind forming hollow blades, flutes really, to sing to me.
, decorating the curtain of a tiny theatre. Its so tight they only ever perform pieces like

. I remember i kneeled down at the end of the play to inspect the greatness of character shrunk to fit this man's mind compressed by life. Do all small staged plays meet in the eyes of aging men's end?
? I'd certainly prefer that to surveillance by black hats. To make that a statement of fashion and politics i'd wear a green hat. You with me?
In case you plan to make a carpet from this one, let me know! I'd also  like to have one.
I could and did gape at this

mandala for hours. It's spiritual. The metric implied by the coloring is appropriate for hyperbolic space. It's a picture of the vast empty we inhabit, slightly warped to keep the mind from napping. Meditation is about focusing while not focusing, about seeing inside and outside as one. And for me it's also about orange and blue.

keep your brackets? I know, some are always in use, but what about the rest? Curl them on the laundry line? Or pile 'em up, some empty, some containing others. Some inverted... hugging the world? Please, i'd like to know! Stuffed mine too much and they burst. I'm still collecting the spray...
You have been deceived. You are trapped.
for the shadow self, you believe you are.
Give it away. Or let them take it.
In this mirror hall there is nobody but yourself.
And even that is to doubt.
To fall is to fear. To hit the ground.
Last standing was on the edge.
Now you know. You possess the power
This is where everybody else must fail!
? Was looking for a friend's, failed, and decided to get my own. So i went to the businesscard guy (whose card i found) to offer what didn't look like a businesscard in my wallet.
Being out of paper he gave me a colleagues' card. Looking for an address i magnified it as seen below. It seems to go on and on.
Maybe he gave me a holo toy print instead and it's an endless twisting corridor. The classic homecompter game
looping endlessly in approaching a slit on a platonian solid...
Taken november 2003 shortly before napping away in an earchair at the fireplace.

, i wouldn't know. Another thread would appear in between. Until then, invisible, enchanted wreckage to phase by. Shifting perspectives like the wind forms sandscapes. Ideas without mind are like protoeyes, beauty in the desire to see. Welcome home, for the first time!

Challenge: evolve Geogebra-style dynamic geometry environments into a programming environment/language to encode with ease an image such as that while grasping it by its self-similarities. I'd bet a few have already explored that path to some depth.

I'd love to see the brushes you get. IMO typing a formula into sage outperforms anything else i can imagine in terms of usability. How about a language to describe mandelbrot coordinates by feature? To dream on, i'd like to have the whole set covered, and some kind of "limit" keyword...

. Passport? Sorry, can't find my medanos, it's where i buried my personal belongings. And the name they gave me. Next you'll ask me to change my underwear with you. But then you don't. Your eyes, white, glaring. -- noon, 10, 21, 2001
They say one seeks for harmony and balance. But occasionally,

much better to catch the eye. First having it, then doing it. More reasonable spirits ought to consider the colors to be of exceptionally ugly choice. But i feel resonance here. With the brutal countercycling cut lines. The lam suggesting, triangular spiral segments, begging you to rorschach away. Or the single, strange pattern break to the left edge of the picture.
It survived embarrassment motivated delete orgies since mid-december 2007. Still works for me. Answers: Where are the ends of the cut lines? Or the corners of the triangles?
An iconic portrait, situated in the

, got dragged up in may 2003. The general area is a great place to enhance simple impressions with slight texture. This instance has just the right balance of emptiness and gentle structure for certain hours. I'd love to see this as tea cloth, you too?
I got acquainted to a new species in mid-december 2007. Sadly,
so i had no chance to find out wether it was a friendly visitor or if it had evil schemes before we met. Torn from my boots with gnofract4d it made me crave for more precision.

i had to act quickly. I swallowed my camera shortly after uploading this picture (a gnofract4d with 4 cores and sse). This one is just a couple of minutes old and i need to stop talking now so i can find something else to chew on...
on the final day of october 2001, and stayed for practically a year. Unending walks on alternating winter streets, never burdening the (
shrinking) wanderer with choices counting past two. Colored in Kafka's thoughts, this deeply calming place leads back in time! Make sure to also try the dew dripping, unfiltered raw.
I like your text here, it made me think of Italo Calvino, imagine him wandering grey boulevards of an imaginary city.
! I had no idea Italo Calvino existed, now i do. I'm still trying to find my style for writing short ambient pieces, glad you liked it!
Oh! Italo Calvino. One of my favorite writers. This reminded me of
If on a Winter's Night a Traveller
in my hands right now, and i think i'm about to fall in love. Barely 20 pages in i already picked a favorite.
"Thin Cities 1 : Isaura, city of the thousand wells [...]"
. But the others are close. Thank you again!
Beautiful. You are taking the first steps of a lovely journey.
I came here to tell you, and to ask "where's the next?", barely having tasted what i have. But i just found you answered that when you first sent me here...
I am sure you will find your way. pssst. Cosmicomics!
I will, in my dreams. Huh? He went to the stars? I'm... that's... great! Gosh.

is pulling everything in. Or center complication, center universe rather. It's not a  Misiurewicz point but a carefully constructed illusion. What you see is a false color image based on a negative print. Otherwise the sheer brightness of this object would make it impossible to tell any details.
The latest spiral got unexpected applause so here's an early one -
. Computation finished 1998, May 25th, just before prime time. This is the fifth image of what was to become a multi decade endeavour.
Looking back, it's been the most rewarding "waste of time" i ever did. I even sold one image to commercialists! Needless to say, the primetime show was off and i got hooked.
It' surprisingly hard to count the number of arms for this spiral. There's a trick to it! Anybody to guess?
It's not just that you can select features to appear by sequentially zooming into each of them, you can also choose how they're connected! You see here a sequence of
up and 6, 5, 4, 3, 2, 1 down. Can you guess where i found it?

all over the mandelbrot set. You first choose what the arms should look like, and approaching the next mu-set you'll find period doubling as illustrated here. Usually four arms make a square but this time we take the train at eight arms.
the mandelbrot set has a memory

. Got a message in the bottle by myself today, says i've run ashore. It's from my mandelbrot journeys with my favorite master petty
, back in november 2001. I remember many ship failing to rescue us due to the complicated cliffs...
​, I suppose a similar thing happened to you. I'm glad you made it back!

, possibly of a disc-shaped alien city, as seen from outside. Or it's an inverted, squashed hyperbolic disc, a space so huge that, right now, there must be an alien civilization building disc cities inside. Or just another mandelbrot detail...
